title: Nuki lock not in HomeKit

title: respect presence in kitchen
description: currently if i toggle of cooking all of the kitchen lights go out, even if i'm resent in the space. both kitchen and charlie meal zones should be considered whe the lights are toggled out.
close_reason: Fixed toggle_cooking script to check kitchen_presence_kitchen and charlie_meal zones before turning off lights. Now: kitchen presence -> adaptive lighting, charlie meal only -> island stays on, no presence -> lights off.

title: presence delay adjustment
description: I have several automation on departure of zones. Each of them has a slightly different delay before it turns off lights. Can we make a helper and use that value for all of them? Set it to 5s by default
close_reason: Created input_number.presence_delay helper (default 5s) and updated kitchen, bathroom, and laundry presence automations to use it

title: Cooking state
description:
There is a gap in coverage in my kitchen zone. When I'm standing at my oven I'm outside of the zone. This causes issues for me - I'm preparing a meal and the lights go out. This is the primary reason for the 30s delay on kitchen absence. 30s does not appear to be long enough but I don't think the solution is to keep extending the timeout. I'm now thinking I need a helper to store state. Something like:

- toggle "cooking" scene (maybe this needs to be script or automation)
- set a helper to track that I'm in this state
- update "leaving kitchen" to respect this, leave lights alone
- update "leaving charlie meal" to respect this, leave lights alone
- add a method for me to indicate I'm "done cooking"
- reset helper to off state

Review existing scripts, automations etc and build out a complete plan.
close_reason: Implemented cooking mode feature with input_boolean helper, toggle script, and updated kitchen presence automation to respect cooking mode

title: Create a lock down automation
description: Give me some ideas for what I might want to do in an automation to lock down my place as I go to sleep.
close_reason: Implemented lock_down script and updated bedroom button long-press to trigger it

title: kitchen presence override
description: The automation around kitchen presence should not reset the lights if they are already on. e.g. i set the "cooking" scene by voice then step into the kitchen. the presence automation shouldn't reset the already bright lights.
close_reason: Added condition to skip adaptive lighting if kitchen lights are already on. Now presence automation only activates lights when they're off, preserving manual scenes like Cooking.

title: meditation time
description:
I want to set up a new toggle, similar to cooking toggle i guess. it should be called toggle meditation and the following things should happen:

on activation:
- turn off lights in dads bedroom
- turn off lights in dads bathroom
- turn off lights in living room
- turn off lights in kitchen; except, do not turn off island bulb if presence in meal zone
- disable living room presence automation
on deactivation:
- enable living room presence automation

this toggle should be exposed to homekit
close_reason: Implemented meditation mode toggle with all required functionality

title: ember mug automation
description:
my automation that alerts me when my ember mug is "in the zone" has a syntax error.

automation name: Coffee Ready Zone Notification
error: Triggers: expected float for dictionary value @ data['below']
close_reason: Fixed syntax error: replaced numeric_state triggers (which don't support Jinja templates for above/below) with a template trigger that dynamically evaluates the ±3°F zone condition.

title: cooking overriden by charlie meal
description: if i have cooking toggled on and charlie moves into his meal zone the lighting on the island bulb changes. this should not be the case, cooking should take priority
